page.title: 12A LOCAL PERSON REMEMBERS
page.content: Reuben spoke to 76 year old Mr England who remembers Sunday school treats to Sheringham,when they all went on a farm wagon.He remembers his parents going to chapel in the evening.There were strict rules about chapel going and life on Sundays at home.His father was head gardener at Barningham Hall.At school he played football and hide and seek.When he left school he worked on a farm and was paid 10 shillings a week.His main work was ploughing.In the evening he went to various clubs such as cricket,bowls and foot- ball.Mr England was born on the Matlaske Estate and moved to the'Norfolk Nest',a house near the shop.He remembers the rectory and fields as meadow where he used to play.He went to Matlaske school which had 3 classes.The head was Mr Woods.
